Response Table with ADaM data structure

Response Table with ADaM data structure

response_table_ADAM(ASL, ARS, paramcd = "OVRSPI", arm.var = "ARM", arm.ref,
  arm.comp, arm.comp.combine = TRUE, value.resp = c("CR", "PR"),
  value.nresp = c("SD", "NON CR/PD", "PD", "NE"), incl.missing = TRUE,
  strata.var = NULL, style = 1)

Arguments

ASL

dataset with following variables: USUBJID, STUDYID, the specified grouping variable
ARS

ARS dataset containing the following variables: USUBJID, STUDYID, PARAMCD, AVALC
paramcd

Name of overall response parameter
arm.var

Name of variable with arm information
arm.ref

Character vector, defining which arm(s) from the list of arms should be used as reference group
arm.comp

Character vector, defining which arm(s) from the list of arms should be used as comparison group
arm.comp.combine

Logical, TRUE if want all non-ref arms to be combined into one comparison group, FALSE if want each of the non-ref arms to be a separate comparison group
incl.missing

Logical, TRUE if missing values should be considered non-responders, FALSE if missing response should be removed from analysis
style

Must be 1 or 2, 1 if only want to display rates summary for each response value category, 2 if want to display rates, difference in rate and odds ratio for each response value category.
value.rsp

Character vector, defining list of response values to be used as responders
value.nrsp

Character vector, defining list of response values to be used as non-responders
strata

Character vector, defining stratification factor for stratified analysis, default is NULL

Details

Package forcats was used to re-format arm data into leveled factors. Package epiR was used to compute 2-by-2 contingency table statistics and analysis with stratification factors.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
library(dplyr)
library(atezo.data)
library(teal.oncology)
library(forcats)
library(epiR)

'%needs%' <- teal.oncology:::'%needs%'

ASL <- asl(com.roche.cdt30019.go29436.re)
ARS <- ars(com.roche.cdt30019.go29436.re)

teal.oncology:::response_table_ADAM(ASL, ARS,
                    paramcd = "OVRSPI",
                    arm.ref = "DUMMY C",
                    arm.comp = c("DUMMY A", "DUMMY B"),
                    arm.comp.combine = FALSE,
                    value.resp = c("CR", "PR"),
                    value.nresp = c("SD", "NON CR/PD", "PD", "NE"),
                    incl.missing = TRUE,
                    strata.var = "SEX",
                    style = 1
                    )
# }
